verses.kjv: At the same time, saith the LORD, will I be the God of all the families of Israel, and they shall be my people.
verses.ct: "When that time comes," declares the LORD, "I will be the God of every family in Israel, and they will be my people."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, The people which were left of the sword found grace in the wilderness; even Israel, when I went to cause him to rest.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "The people who survived the sword found grace in the wilderness — Israel, when I went to give them rest."

verses.kjv: The LORD hath appeared of old unto me, saying, Yea, I have loved thee with an everlasting love: therefore with lovingkindness have I drawn thee.
verses.ct: The LORD appeared to me long ago and said, "Yes, I have loved you with a love that never ends. That is why I have continued to draw you to myself with faithful kindness."

verses.kjv: Again I will build thee, and thou shalt be built, O virgin of Israel: thou shalt again be adorned with thy tabrets, and shalt go forth in the dances of them that make merry.
verses.ct: "I will rebuild you, and you will be rebuilt, young Israel. You will once again pick up your tambourines and dance joyfully with those who celebrate."

verses.kjv: Thou shalt yet plant vines upon the mountains of Samaria: the planters shall plant, and shall eat them as common things.
verses.ct: "You will again plant vineyards on the hills of Samaria. Those who plant them will enjoy their fruit."

verses.kjv: For there shall be a day, that the watchmen upon the mount Ephraim shall cry, Arise ye, and let us go up to Zion unto the LORD our God.
verses.ct: "A day is coming when watchmen on the hills of Ephraim will call out, 'Get up! Let's go up to Zion, to the LORD our God!'"

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD; Sing with gladness for Jacob, and shout among the chief of the nations: publish ye, praise ye, and say, O LORD, save thy people, the remnant of Israel.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "Sing joyfully for Jacob! Shout among the greatest of nations! Proclaim it, give praise, and say, 'LORD, rescue your people, the survivors of Israel!'"

verses.kjv: Behold, I will bring them from the north country, and gather them from the coasts of the earth, and with them the blind and the lame, the woman with child and her that travaileth with child together: a great company shall return thither.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I will bring them back from the northern lands and gather them from the farthest corners of the earth. Among them will be the blind and the lame, pregnant women and those in labor — a huge crowd will return."

verses.kjv: They shall come with weeping, and with supplications will I lead them: I will cause them to walk by the rivers of waters in a straight way, wherein they shall not stumble: for I am a father to Israel, and Ephraim is my firstborn.
verses.ct: "They will come weeping, and I will lead them as they pray. I will guide them along streams of water on a level path where they won't stumble, because I am a father to Israel, and Ephraim is my firstborn son."

verses.kjv: Hear the word of the LORD, O ye nations, and declare it in the isles afar off, and say, He that scattered Israel will gather him, and keep him, as a shepherd doth his flock.
verses.ct: Listen to the word of the LORD, you nations! Announce it on distant shores and say, "The one who scattered Israel will gather them back and watch over them like a shepherd guards his flock."

verses.kjv: For the LORD hath redeemed Jacob, and ransomed him from the hand of him that was stronger than he.
verses.ct: The LORD has rescued Jacob and freed him from the grip of someone stronger than him.

verses.kjv: Therefore they shall come and sing in the height of Zion, and shall flow together to the goodness of the LORD, for wheat, and for wine, and for oil, and for the young of the flock and of the herd: and their soul shall be as a watered garden; and they shall not sorrow any more at all.
verses.ct: They will come and sing on the heights of Zion, streaming together toward the LORD's goodness — toward grain, new wine, olive oil, and young livestock. Their souls will be like a well-watered garden, and they will never grieve again.

verses.kjv: Then shall the virgin rejoice in the dance, both young men and old together: for I will turn their mourning into joy, and will comfort them, and make them rejoice from their sorrow.
verses.ct: Then young women will celebrate with dancing, and young men and old men will join in. I will turn their mourning into joy, comfort them, and replace their sorrow with gladness.

verses.kjv: And I will satiate the soul of the priests with fatness, and my people shall be satisfied with my goodness, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "I will fill the priests' souls with abundance, and my people will be satisfied with my goodness," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation, and bitter weeping; Rahel weeping for her children refused to be comforted for her children, because they were not.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "A voice is heard in Ramah — bitter crying and deep weeping. Rachel is weeping for her children, refusing to be comforted, because they are gone."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Refrain thy voice from weeping, and thine eyes from tears: for thy work shall be rewarded, saith the LORD; and they shall come again from the land of the enemy.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "Hold back your voice from crying and your eyes from tears, because your efforts will be rewarded," declares the LORD. "They will return from the enemy's land."

verses.kjv: And there is hope in thine end, saith the LORD, that thy children shall come again to their own border.
verses.ct: "There is hope for your future," declares the LORD. "Your children will return to their own territory."

verses.kjv: I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning himself thus; Thou hast chastised me, and I was chastised, as a bullock unaccustomed to the yoke: turn thou me, and I shall be turned; for thou art the LORD my God.
verses.ct: "I have clearly heard Ephraim grieving: 'You disciplined me, and I accepted the discipline, like a young bull not yet trained to the yoke. Bring me back, and I will return, because you are the LORD my God.'"

verses.kjv: Surely after that I was turned, I repented; and after that I was instructed, I smote upon my thigh: I was ashamed, yea, even confounded, because I did bear the reproach of my youth.
verses.ct: "'After I turned away, I was filled with regret. After I understood, I slapped my thigh in shame. I was humiliated and disgraced because I carried the guilt of my younger days.'"

verses.kjv: Is Ephraim my dear son? is he a pleasant child? for since I spake against him, I do earnestly remember him still: therefore my bowels are troubled for him; I will surely have mercy upon him, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "Is Ephraim not my precious son? Is he not a child I delight in? Even though I often spoke against him, I still think about him constantly. My heart aches for him. I will certainly show him mercy," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Set thee up waymarks, make thee high heaps: set thine heart toward the highway, even the way which thou wentest: turn again, O virgin of Israel, turn again to these thy cities.
verses.ct: "Set up road markers for yourselves. Put up guideposts. Focus on the highway — the road you traveled before. Come back, young Israel! Return to your cities."

verses.kjv: How long wilt thou go about, O thou backsliding daughter? for the LORD hath created a new thing in the earth, A woman shall compass a man.
verses.ct: "How long will you wander, unfaithful daughter? The LORD has created something new on the earth — a woman will embrace a man."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; As yet they shall use this speech in the land of Judah and in the cities thereof, when I shall bring again their captivity; The LORD bless thee, O habitation of justice, and mountain of holiness.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: "When I restore their fortunes, people in the land of Judah and its cities will once again say, 'May the LORD bless you, home of righteousness, mountain of holiness.'"

verses.kjv: And there shall dwell in Judah itself, and in all the cities thereof together, husbandmen, and they that go forth with flocks.
verses.ct: "Farmers and those who move about with their flocks will live together in Judah and all its cities."

verses.kjv: For I have satiated the weary soul, and I have replenished every sorrowful soul.
verses.ct: "I will refresh the exhausted soul and fill every grieving soul."

verses.kjv: Upon this I awaked, and beheld; and my sleep was sweet unto me.
verses.ct: At this point I woke up and looked around, and my sleep had been pleasant.

verses.kjv: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man, and with the seed of beast.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — the days are coming," declares the LORD, "when I will fill the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the offspring of people and animals."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that like as I have watched over them, to pluck up, and to break down, and to throw down, and to destroy, and to afflict; so will I watch over them, to build, and to plant, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "Just as I watched over them to uproot, tear down, demolish, destroy, and bring disaster, so I will watch over them to build up and to plant," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: In those days they shall say no more, The fathers have eaten a sour grape, and the children’s teeth are set on edge.
verses.ct: "In those days, people will no longer say, 'The parents ate sour grapes, and the children's teeth suffered for it.'"

verses.kjv: But every one shall die for his own iniquity: every man that eateth the sour grape, his teeth shall be set on edge.
verses.ct: "Instead, each person will die for their own sin. Whoever eats the sour grapes — their own teeth will suffer."

verses.kjv: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel, and with the house of Judah:
verses.ct: "Pay attention — the days are coming," declares the LORD, "when I will establish a new covenant with the house of Israel and the house of Judah."

verses.kjv: Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day that I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt; which my covenant they brake, although I was an husband unto them, saith the LORD:
verses.ct: "It will not be like the covenant I made with their ancestors when I took them by the hand and led them out of Egypt — a covenant they broke, even though I was like a husband to them," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: But this shall be the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel; After those days, saith the LORD, I will put my law in their inward parts, and write it in their hearts; and will be their God, and they shall be my people.
verses.ct: "Instead, this is the covenant I will make with the house of Israel after those days," declares the LORD. "I will place my law within them and write it on their hearts. I will be their God, and they will be my people."

verses.kjv: And they shall teach no more every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying, Know the LORD: for they shall all know me, from the least of them unto the greatest of them, saith the LORD: for I will forgive their iniquity, and I will remember their sin no more.
verses.ct: "No one will need to teach their neighbor or their brother anymore, saying, 'Know the LORD,' because they will all know me, from the least important to the most important," declares the LORD. "I will forgive their sin and never remember it again."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, which giveth the sun for a light by day, and the ordinances of the moon and of the stars for a light by night, which divideth the sea when the waves thereof roar; The LORD of hosts is his name:
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says — the one who provides the sun to light the day and establishes the moon and stars to light the night, who stirs up the sea so its waves roar — the LORD of Hosts is his name:

verses.kjv: If those ordinances depart from before me, saith the LORD, then the seed of Israel also shall cease from being a nation before me for ever.
verses.ct: "Only if these fixed laws ever disappear from my presence," declares the LORD, "would the descendants of Israel ever stop being a nation in my presence."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; If heaven above can be measured, and the foundations of the earth searched out beneath, I will also cast off all the seed of Israel for all that they have done, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "Only if the heavens above could be measured and the foundations of the earth below could be explored would I reject all of Israel's descendants for everything they have done," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that the city shall be built to the LORD from the tower of Hananeel unto the gate of the corner.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — the days are coming," declares the LORD, "when the city will be rebuilt for the LORD, from the Tower of Hananeel to the Corner Gate."

verses.kjv: And the measuring line shall yet go forth over against it upon the hill Gareb, and shall compass about to Goath.
verses.ct: "The measuring line will stretch out further, over the hill of Gareb, and then turn toward Goath."

verses.kjv: And the whole valley of the dead bodies, and of the ashes, and all the fields unto the brook of Kidron, unto the corner of the horse gate toward the east, shall be holy unto the LORD; it shall not be plucked up, nor thrown down any more for ever.
verses.ct: "The entire valley where dead bodies and ashes are thrown, and all the fields as far as the Kidron Valley, to the corner of the Horse Gate on the east — all of it will be set apart as holy to the LORD. It will never again be uprooted or torn down."
